awd_titl_txt: P + A and A + A Studies with a Focussing Spectrometer at theCERN SPS (Physics)
awd_abstract_narration: This grant provides funding for participation in the study                 of p+A and A+A collisions at the CERN SPS using a focussing                     spectrometer.  The experiments will study single identified                     particle distributions (pions, kaons, and protons) as well as                   two-pion and two-kaon correlations for 450 GeV p+A and 200                      GeV/nucleon S, Pb+A collisions.  Using a small acceptance                       focussing spectrometer with high resolution TOF, these                          measurements will obtain excellent momentum resolution, high                    statistics in the phase space of interest, and good particle                    identification.  The Pittsburgh contribution to the experiment                  will be for the TOF system, Monte Carlo studies, and data                       analysis.                                                                            The work is designed to probe the spatial and temporal                     extent of the quark-gluon plasma region that is predicted to                    occur in relativistic heavy ion collisions.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
